short_description: Discover the hidden gem of the Balkans, Albania, with its stunning Adriatic and Ionian coastlines, ancient ruins, and vibrant culture. Explore the historic cities, pristine beaches, and breathtaking mountain landscapes while experiencing the warm hospitality of the Albanian people.

health.tap_water_safety: Generally safe in major cities, bottled water recommended in rural areas
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, supermarkets, and shops

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Albania has a Mediterranean climate along the coast with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. The interior has a more continental climate with colder winters.

when_to_visit.title: Winter
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild along the coast but colder in the mountains. Great time for winter sports in the Albanian Alps and exploring cities without the summer crowds

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Albania is during the spring (April to May) and autumn (September to October) months when the weather is mild and pleasant, making it ideal for exploring both the beautiful coastline and historic inland cities
